page.title: 08LIMERIGG RELIGION 4
page.content: During the 19th century,with an increasing population,Limerigg numbered many people of the Roman Catholic Faith. Naturally they wished for a church of their own and by 1885 a church was completed and consecrated Barnsmuir,near the Black Loch. It was named "St. Mary's". The first Christmas Eve Mass was celebrated in the new chapel in 1885. The celebrant at the Midnight Mass was the Rev. C. C. Mackenzie from St. Francis Xavier, Falkirk. The first priest to carry out regular duties travelled from Falkirk, but later moved into the new Chapel House. However,as the mining population began to decline so too did the number of members at "St. Mary's". In 1955, the Rev. Bernard G. O'Donnell became parish priest. At first he occupied the Chapel House.
